original_text:
The onboarding flow starts with a quick check on the customer’s email to ensure it looks valid. When it passes, Salesforce is queried to see if a matching contact already exists. If no record comes back, a new contact is created with the customer’s basic details and tagged as coming from the automated workflow.

A welcome email is then sent through Gmail to acknowledge the customer and let them know their account is ready. Even if email delivery encounters issues, the process continues. A Slack channel is also created for internal coordination around that customer, using a cleaned-up version of the email as the channel name.

Once these touchpoints are attempted, the workflow logs a final entry summarizing the account check, any new record created, and the Slack channel information, marking the onboarding as complete.

tasks.title: Validate customer email format
tasks.description: Perform a quick validation check on the customer's email address to ensure it has a valid format before proceeding with onboarding

text_span.text: a quick check on the customer's email to ensure it looks valid

tasks.error: Email format validation is a simple programmatic check that doesn't require external API calls or specialized tools. None of the available tools are designed for basic email format validation - they are focused on sending emails, managing mailing lists, or interacting with external services. This task requires a simple regex or string validation function that should be handled in application code rather than through an external tool.

tasks.title: Query Salesforce for existing contact
tasks.description: Search Salesforce to determine if a contact with the customer's email already exists in the system

text_span.text: Salesforce is queried to see if a matching contact already exists

tasks.title: Create new Salesforce contact if none exists
tasks.description: If no matching contact is found in Salesforce, create a new contact record with the customer's basic details and tag it as coming from the automated workflow

text_span.text: If no record comes back, a new contact is created with the customer's basic details and tagged as coming from the automated workflow

tasks.title: Send welcome email via Gmail
tasks.description: Send a welcome email through Gmail to the customer acknowledging their registration and informing them that their account is ready

text_span.text: A welcome email is then sent through Gmail to acknowledge the customer and let them know their account is ready

tasks.title: Create Slack channel for customer coordination
tasks.description: Create a new Slack channel for internal team coordination related to this customer, using a sanitized version of the customer's email as the channel name

text_span.text: A Slack channel is also created for internal coordination around that customer, using a cleaned-up version of the email as the channel name

tasks.title: Log onboarding completion summary
tasks.description: Create a final log entry that summarizes the entire onboarding process, including the account check results, any new Salesforce record created, and the Slack channel information, then mark the onboarding as complete

text_span.text: the workflow logs a final entry summarizing the account check, any new record created, and the Slack channel information, marking the onboarding as complete

agent_notes: [2025-12-02 16:05:58] Session initialized with 6 tasks extracted from user input.

[2025-12-02 16:06:33] The email validation task has been removed as it requires basic string/regex validation that should be handled in application code rather than through external API tools. All available tools are designed for API interactions with external services (Salesforce, Gmail, Slack, etc.), not for programmatic data validation. The workflow will proceed assuming email validation occurs at the application layer before these tool-based tasks execute. The remaining tasks are properly sequenced and can be executed with the available tools.
